headline: Applied Materials Stock Drops in Another Blow to Semis. Why This Analyst Turned Bearish.
summary: Applied Materials  stock fell Thursday after a Morgan Stanley analyst downgraded shares of the semiconductor equipment manufacturer, citing concerns for the markets it serves.  Joseph Moore changed his rating on the stock to Underweight from Equal Weight and cut his target for the price to $164 from $179.  “Our call isn’t for substantial downside but as a relative UW [underweight] within the US SPE [semiconductor process equipment] cohort as we think it will be hard for the stock to outperform with their end-market exposure,” Moore wrote in a research note.

headline: American Eagle, Applied Materials, HPE: Top analyst calls
summary: JPMorgan analysts downgrade American Eagle (AEO) to Neutral from Overweight and cut its price target to $23 from $27 after the retailer lowered its revenue outlook, citing weak holiday sales expectations. Applied Materials (AMAT) stock is declining after getting a downgrade to Underweight from Equal Weight from Morgan Stanley due to its outlook for the first half of 2025. Morgan Stanley analysts upgrade Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE) to Overweight from Equal Weight with a price target boost to $28 from $23 on enterprise opportunity. Brad Smith and Madison Mills take a closer look at the analyst calls on Morning Brief. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief here. This post was written by Naomi Buchanan.
